column5: This looks pretty good to me. Anyone have any experience with Camp Narrows? Looks like pretty good smallmouth fishing. I want something special to remember for my family and kids on our first canadian fishing trip.

Yeah, Jeff, I've been there twice and will be returning this coming Labor Day week. Tom runs a great camp. His dad built all the cabins. They are rustic, comfortable with no uninvited guests. We always have something for the the friendly and entertaining camp dogs. If you are doing American Plan, the food is very good; if not, the kitchen area in the cabin works very well.It's about a seven mile trip from the ramp to Camp. That part of Rainy fishes 'small.' There are plenty of island and cuts to get out of the wind. My son's best walleye (27") and smallmouth came from those waters. Lots of 'eyes over the slot. Northern are everywhere. I had a 40"+ break off on me. We did get get lucky one day and boated 14 walleyes in about a half hour. Send me a PM if you have any more questions.NimstugThe physician can bury his mistakes, but the architect can only advise his clients to plant vines. -F.L. Wright
